library.controllers

Class BaseController<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • library.controllers.BaseController<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AvailabilityController, BookController, BorrowController, ReaderController

    public abstract class BaseController<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a generic base controller is used as a base controller to avoid writing the same code over and over again it is used to tell the classes that extends from it what methods will be necessary to edit the files that keeps the data of the system. This class is used to call the File Handlers which is our Database, respecting the MVC Approach, the views will call the controllers and the controllers will call the file handlers which would be one of our models

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(T element)
      calls the respective file handle and the method to add a new line to the CSV
      void edit(T element)
      calls the respective file handler to edit a line in the CSV
      abstract T[] getAll()
      abstract method to get all the objects of a determined type in the MODELS IN MEMORY Class, which is our cached memory
      protected abstract BaseFileHandler<T> getFileHandler()
      returns the respective file handler of a class
      abstract T[] loadFile()
      this method will return the object of the controller that is using it,by calling its respective File Handler, for example if the BookController is using the method it will call the Book File Handler, load the CSV and return an Array of Books each Controller will determine how this method will be handle
      void writeFile(T[] element)
      this method will be used to call the file handler method and will pass the objects to be written in the file
